title: Terrible
comment: Didn't work at alllllll.....

title: Seems cool and inovative. .
comment: But it is quite hard to control and it sometimes randomly restarts on my android And  it does not have a search button. Has potential thoUgh.

title: Intruiging
comment: I am experimenting with this, having heard it mentioned during Christmas University Challenge! It feels like it has the potential to be faster than a conventional on screen keyboard, with some investment in time in order to learn the system. It is great for typing words, but a little fiddly for punctuation: the option to use conventional buttons for symbols would be welcome.

title: An excellent Tech-Demo
comment: but also a good reminder that human/machine interaction is more than just a classical information theory problem. It's usable as a keyboard if you increase the rate, but unless you have special needs, most of today's predictive keyboards are better.
best implementation of Dasher I've seen. works awesome with stylus, but still can't get my WPM (including fixing errors) up to normal thumb typing speed

title: Super Fast and easy to use
comment: Ever since I arrived from Alpha Centauri I've been looking for a simple keyboard like we have back home. It's really easy to use with your pseudopod, unlike all the other keyboards in the play store. Just remember to grock with your orange pseudopod as using your purple one will obscure the screen.

title: Nice idea
comment: And good implementation too but the lack of an enter key (that doubles as a next /finished key) is a bit hard to live with in an android where there's frequently no longer a search/submit button.

title: Very interesting but not very practical.
comment: Requires constant attention to the screen to know what's coming up and it's quite a slow process for typing.

title: Please make it work as standalone too!
comment: I don't want to replace my keyboard immediately, I should still be able to test and show it. Like it works on Linux.

title: Interesting input method.
comment: I've played with this on my Fedora Linux tablet/computer hybrid (testing out other on-screen keyboards)... it's an extremely unique way to input keystrokes.  The more I've practice, the more I love it!

title: Fun to watch
comment: It's like playing a game, watching the words fly past. I quite enjoy writing with it.  Sometimes my finger blocks the letters when I forget what to write next (because I get mesmerised). Very rarely need to correct misspelled words which is great (but then it's also fun to watch the time travellesque letters deleting when I do)

title: Pure genius!
comment: And this was written with Dasher.

title: Mind-blowing
comment: This is more of a game than a keyboard for me, but the concept is simply outstanding!

title: Good idea but didn't work on my LG Optimus One
comment: Tried it but there's a difference between the videos and the real thing, your finger! Couldn't see the letters as my finger was obscuring them. Would it be better to move the "origin" to the left, rather than centre of the screen? After a couple of attempts it locked up (my phone is overcrowded, so maybe not Dasher's fault) and had to switch off to recover, then reload most settings :-(   Three stars as it's got great potential.
Verrrrrry slowww

title: Good but slooooooow!
comment: I see that it's best for chaloenged people. For me though, it takes a looooong time to assemble a sentence.

title: An Excellent Keyboard Replacement
comment: I do not have a physical imparment that requires me to use Dasher. I choose to use Dasher because it is incredibly fast and intuitive. The learning curve from novice to expert is small.  It has is highly customizable especially if you don't mind moving some files around.  My only complaint is that the App is not well documented on the developer's website. It would behoove the developer to post a robust tutorial, one which breaks down all the options and their effects on the interface. Also, am in-App method to change the colours being used, would allow users to better integrate the app with their themes.  And to the Developer's: Thank You.

title: Amazing
comment: Thank you!!! I'm going to use this program to help my ALS suffering father. This is the ONLY way to input text via eyetracking that isn't painful and idiotic. Perfect!

title: Interesting.
comment: Holy cost
intriguing

title: Pretty awesome.
comment: Unique style of data input. While not the fastest method definitely the most enjoyable method I have ever used

title: Very different, but absorbing
comment: Actually designed for use by people suffering from paralysis, Dasher is quite ingenious, and helpful on bumpy roads for this android-er.

title: Excellent implementation and open source
comment: Really very nice, again not as fast as swype for example but I came to this with interested in the used for disabled people and a totally different way to type, I have to say I'm blow away! Works perfectly with HTC Magic/Dream/the_other_one
This is the hardware dasher has been waiting 18 years for. Try it out!
Good conversion, but the menu system is horrible - there's v. little explanation, and its navigation is inconsistent with the rest of android.
Very interesting. Reasonably fast as well. I always feel like i'm playing a game whenever I type though...
Really could use more symbols, at the very least the @ symbol! Edit: found it when the Alphabet Name is set to lots of punctuation.
Excellent ive been waiting for the verticle mode.
Excellent app. Does what it says.
Excellent input system, but Dasher “universe” often obstructs text box. Non-issue for text entry, but breaks editing. Need alternative cursor control.
Meh, interesting concept, but not too practical when you have a much faster keyboard. Best used when showing off your phone.
Interesting, but slow compared to classic keyboards.
Good port overall. Tilt input works well. But, in landscape doesn't leave any room for the text field.
One of the cooler proof of concept entry methods. Really is amazing.
I have been waiting for a Dasher app since I got my Android. Not the most practical input method, but definitely the most fun.
Slowwwww
Interesting but very slow to type with
Love it. Fun!
Cool idea, seems to do what swift key does but with a less usable interface
Excellent concept. I can't wait to see this with eye tracking hardware/software implementation. Kudos!
doesn't work on my xperia x10..
Not as quick as swype for day to day typing, but who cares? It's epically awesome. Dave Mackay for the win.
Does not work on HTC Legend.
A nice port of this great tool.
Nice port. Quite smooth. Needs a little bit of polishing but still in early beta. Dasher is a v nice thing. Thanks.
The maximum speed setting doesn't seem to be very permanent on my HTC Hero.
Cool. a little had to use as my finger gets in the way! Nice port, though.
Very difficult to use. Not as fast as swype and clones.
